TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SearchCredentials extends Microsoft.Rest.ServiceClientCredentials

Docs.summary: Credentials used to authenticate to an Azure Search service.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string apiKey) cil managed

Docs.param: api-key used to authenticate to the Azure Search service.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SearchCredentials class with a query key or an admin key. Use a query key if your application does not require write access to the Search Service or index.
Docs.remarks: If your application performs only query operations on an index, we recommend passing a query key for the parameter. This ensures that you have read-only access to the index, which is consistent with the principle of least privilege.

Docs.summary: api-key used to authenticate to an Azure Search service. Can be either a query key for querying only, or an admin key that enables index and document management as well.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Threading.Tasks.Task ProcessHttpRequestAsync (System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage request, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task ProcessHttpRequestAsync(class System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage request, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds the credentials to the given HTTP request.
Docs.returns: A Task to track the progress of the async operation.
